bibl.title: Territory of Washington v. Walker et al. Coroner Memo
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image.

org.orgName: United States District Court For The Western District of Washington Northern Division

div1.p: In the jury summoned before James D. Witermart Coroner of Pierce County, Wash. Terr: trinquire into the cause of death after having the evidence, and inspecting the body: that the deceased name was Wm M Lockwood: a musician & painter: an American by birth: aged about twenty eight years: and unmeared: that he came to his death upon Thursday morning July 16th '85 between one and three o'clock: That he was found upon the W.P.R.R. track near the house of M.K. & Chal Walker and that we believe from the evidence, that he came to his death by being struck upon the head by some blunt instrument in the hands of M.A. Walker & Charles Walker or both of them: and that Helen Walker has knowledge of such deed: that we believe the body was afterwards placed upon the Rail Road track more the house of said Walkers: and that afterwards his body was run over by the Enquired of the N.P.R.R.W

p.unclear: J.M. Steele M. Brotton Thos W. Daugherty J.E. Wilson

div1.p: Dated before me upon Friday evening July 17th 1885. In the city of Tacoma, Pierce Co. Wash. Terr.
